content:
• Monday, October 7, 2013

  • After - Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top Gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TLM +13.7%. ANV +3.5%. ZSL +2.2%. ACAD +2.1%. NBG +2.0%.
    • Top Losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TWGP -26.8%. NES -10.9%. JMBA -8.6%. NQ -4.8%. MBT -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy +6.5% AH as Icahn discloses 61M-share stake

    • Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) +6.5% AH after surging 4.6% in the final minutes of regular trading, as Carl Icahn discloses a 61M-share stake, or 5.97%, in the company.
    • Icahn tweets that he "may have conversations" with TLM's management regarding strategic alternatives and board seats.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 8 Comments
  • JMBA

    Jamba -5.8% AH on weak outlook for same-store sales growth

    • Jamba (NASDAQ:JMBA) -5.8% AH after saying it sees FY 2013 system-wide same store sales flat to +1%, and store-level margins are seen at 16%-17%, with operating margin of 1%-2%; the company cites weak consumer spending, adverse weather in key markets and increased competition.
    • Q3 system-wide comparable store sales are expected to drop 3.4%.
    • Says JambaGo express smoothie units are opening in ~1,000 food courts across the U.S., bringing total units to more than 1,800.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile announces $150M convertible debt offering, shares -4.4% AH

    • NQ is offering convertible senior notes that are due Oct. 2018, and which can be redeemed by the company in certain circumstances starting Oct. 2016. Underwriters will have the option to purchase an additional $22.5M in notes. (PR)
    • NQ only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes, including working capital needs and potential acquisitions of complementary businesses." The company hasn't been shy about making acquisitions (I, II) to expand its mobile software/services lineup.
    • The offering comes with NQ shares up over 3x YTD. NQ had $15.4M in cash/equivalents at the end of Q2, and no debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • SSW

    Seaspan offers 5.7M shares, $125M in convertible notes

    • Seaspan (NYSE:SSW) -6.3% AH after announcing concurrent public offerings of 5.7M common shares and $125M of convertible notes due 2018; in addition to the 5.7M-share offering, a selling shareholder will offer 300K shares.
    • SSW plans to use net proceeds from the primary offering and convertible note offering for general corporate purposes, which may include funding vessel acquisitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • CVM

    CEL-SCI to sell shares, warrants

    • CEL-SCI (NYSEMKT:CVM) announces plans to sell shares and warrants in a public offering.
    • Proceeds will go towards general corporate purposes. (PR)
    • CVM -17% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • PHH

    Report: PHH exploring break-up and sale

    • PHH Corp. (PHH +5.6%) soared into the close as the company is exploring splitting its mortgage and auto fleet leasing businesses and selling the units, reports Reuters, citing multiple sources.
    • The move has been under discussion for several months, they say, and activist investor Orange Capital last month reported a 5% stake in PHH and called for a break-up of the company.
    • The short-list of those interested in the mortgage unit would have to include specialty servicers Ocwen (NYSE:OCN) and Nationstar (NYSE:NSM).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • KYTH

    Kythera Biopharmaceuticals announces public offering

    • Kythera Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KYTH) announces a $100M public offering.
    • The company will use the proceeds to fund the development and potential commercialization of ATX-101 (the double chin treatment). (PR)
    • Now is probably a good time to recall Goldman's warning from September 17: "KYTH will probably use [ATX-101] data as a catalyst to raise more money."
    • Shares -5.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ISRG

    Citron Research steps-up assault on Intuitive Surgical

    • On the heels of last week's "follow up" bear piece, Citron Research pens an open letter to Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +4.5%).
    • Citron alleges "gross misuse" of the FDA's MAUDE dataset (the subject of last week's report) in a chart published on ISRG's corporate website.
    • Here is one of Citron's "stand out" points: ISRG's "computation and graphing comparison of MAUDE adverse event rates is misleading [because] it is extremely unlikely that FDA AERs on surgeries outside the U.S. will ever be filed. Nevertheless, [ISRG] chooses as a denominator 'completed worldwide surgical procedures.'"
    • Citron also says September's MAUDE reports show "another 102 injury-type reports and another four death-type reports, [exceeding] August's record high, which was itself four times any previous reporting period in the company's history."
    • Full letter
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 7 Comments
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier downgraded at Imperial Capital, refiners fall

    • Refining stocks are lower as HollyFrontier (HFC -0.7%) is hit with a downgrade from Imperial Capital, which dropped its rating to In-Line from Outperform, reduces its price target to $41 from $49, and cuts its 2013 EPS estimate to $3.83 from $4.83 and 2014 EPS estimate to $3.50 from $4.00.
    • The firm sees continued contraction in refining margins and crude price differentials, especially as the southern leg of the Keystone XL pipeline commences operation later this month.
    • Other refiners: VLO -0.6%, TSO -0.8%, MPC -1.4%, PSX -1.5%, WNR -1.4%, ALJ -2.5%, CVI -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Ascendiant Capital initiates Galectin Therapeutics at Buy

    • Ascendiant Capital Markets starts Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +6.8%) at Buy, calling the company "an intriguing speculative small cap investment story."
    • Price target is $13, representing an 18% upside from Friday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum jumps, company reportedly on the block

    • DealReporter states Quantum (QTM-OLD +5%) has has received a buyout offer, and has initiated a sale process in response.
    • Activist investor Starboard Value has reportedly been pressuring the low-end storage hardware/software vendor to evaluate ts options. Starboard took a double-digit stake in Quantum last year, and secured a board seat five months ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma reports publication of observational Brinavess data

    • Shares of Cardiome Pharma (CRME +18.2%) are surging on huge volume.
    • Data from an observational, retrospective study shows 70% of 251 recent-onset AF patients who received Brinavess treatments responded with conversion to sinus rhythm. Median time was 11 minutes.
    • Median ER time for converted Brinavess patients was 6.5 hours.
    • "The finding that 75% of successfully treated BRINAVESS patients remained in normal sinus rhythm after a one year follow-up period - was an extremely interesting and important finding that requires further investigation," the study's principal investigator notes. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • XONE

    ExOne higher; FBR comments on bullish management talks

    • FBR's Ajay Kerjriwal, who is reiterating an Outperform and $75 PT on ExOne (XONE +7.1%), says management indicated at investor meetings it's confident the 3D printer maker can achieve 40%-50% organic revenue growth over the next several years.
    • Also mentioned: ExOne is working with auto industry clients such as BMW and Tesla to create products such as "air-cooled systems that have intricate channels, combustion-related parts, and suspension arms." Mass-production for some parts is expected to start in 2-3 years.
    • Kerkriwal adds management's commentary "suggests strong interest from large industrial companies in establishing JVs/partnership for product/process development," and praises the "competitive superiority" of ExOne's technology.
    • ExOne has had a roller-coaster ride this year. Though shares are still up 164% from a Feb. IPO price of $18, they're down 40% from an Aug. high of $78.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 6 Comments
  • CTIC

    Wells Fargo weighs in on Cell Therapeutics' myelofibrosis treatment

    • Wells Fargo's Brian Abrahams says Cell Therapeutics' (CTIC +18.2%) pacritinib has a "niche market" and may not pose a meaningful threat to Incyte's (INCY -3.6%) myelofibrosis treatment Jakafi. In August, INCY guided for FY13 Jakafi sales of $210-225M.
    • Abrahams' comments come on the heels of CTIC's announcement that it has come to an agreement with the FDA on the SPA for a second Phase 3 trial of pacritinib.
    • Related: Jakafi may have more potential in polycythemia vera than myelofibrosis.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme slips as UBS questions Herceptin visibility

    • Weakness in shares of Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO -3.2%) may be attributable to UBS' Matthew Roden, who notes that tracking the use of rHuPH20 in Herceptin will be difficult, as Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -0.4%) may not disclose the split and royalty information for the breast cancer treatment. 
    • See also: Roche gets authorization for sub-Q Herceptin
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 7 Comments
  • EYPT

    pSivida up sharply after bullish article predicts takeover

    • pSivida (PSDV +8.4%) trades markedly higher on heavy volume.
    • The shares look to be getting a lift from SA contributor Bob's Stocks, who says the stock is worth "way north of $15/share" based on the company's share of revenues from the DME treatment Iluvien.
    • The author is also "95% sure" that the company's upcoming (October 17) PDUFA meeting with the FDA will go well and calls the polymide tube's chances of U.S. approval "a slam dunk."
    • Bob's Stocks also thinks the company is "a huge takeover target for big pharma who want to dominate the ocular market."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor lower after OTR Global warning

    • Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.1%) crumble after OTR Global warns on sales trends for the company's Ugg brand.
    • A couple of eagle-eyed retail analysts note the company is now using a sheepskin substitute called UGGpure for some of its boots.
    • The ploy could help margins, but also risks denting the brand's reputation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 3 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: VISN +57%. GWPH +38%. JRJC +33%. ALTI +25%. RCON +21%. ANV +20%. FFHL +19%. CTIC +20%. ARCW +18%. EFUT +20%.
    • Top 10 Losers: ATOS -47%. OTC:ACFN -24%. EVK -15%. AEHR -12%. CTB -12%. SKBI -11%. LQDT -11%. MTRN -10%. MNKD -8%. OTCPK:IFNY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • FST

    Forest Oil's asset sale raises valuation concerns

    • The downdraft in shares of Forest Oil (FST -6.1%) extends to a second day after Friday's disappointing reaction to the $1B sale of its Texas Panhandle assets.
    • A new Seeking Alpha blog says the recent deal has "left the cupboard looking bare... With high leverage and a multiple that doesn't match its asset quality, the shares could drop 25-45% more."
    • With only ~28K net acres in the Eagle Ford and east Texas economics subdued by low gas prices, the thinking is that FST will need to eventually pursue acquisitions to bolster its portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek rallies after announcing partnership with Experian

    • Mitek (MITK +3.7%) and Experian (OTCQX:EXPGF, OTCQX:EXPGY - a top financial information/credit data provider) are partnering to offer a solution that eliminates manual data entry for consumers looking to set up bank accounts using mobile devices. (PR)
    • The solution combines Mitek's Mobile Photo Account Opening product with Experian's fraud prevention/authentication services. Consumers can upload front/back pictures of their driver's licenses taken with a phone's camera to provide banks with needed info, in lieu of typing the info using a phone's keyboard.
    • Though below its June highs, Mitek is up 67% YTD following a rough 2012. 24.4% of the float was shorted as of Sep. 13.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • SRPT

    Deutsche says Sarepta fair value could exceed $200 per share

    • Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +1.9%) may be up 100% YTD, but that doesn't mean it can't rally another 294% or so, Deutsche's Robyn Karnauskas thinks.
    • Karnauskas — whose price target is currently $71 — further highlights the apparent efficacy disparity between drisapersen and eteplirsen noting that patients taking eteplirsen saw "stabilization in 6MWD as early as 24 weeks [and remained] stable even at 96 weeks."
    • Here's the real kicker though: "We could see FV in $98-$125 range if we assume 100% probability to Eteplirsen and 80-100% market share in treated patients. If we assume 100% probability to their other exon program, we get to SRPT FV of $213/share." (emphasis added)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • DWCH

    Datawatch jumps following Craig-Hallum coverage launch

    • CH has started coverage on Datawatch (DWCH +6.9%) with a Buy and $37 PT.
    • The launch comes six weeks after Datawatch closed its $50M acquisition of data visualization/analytics software vendor Panopticon.
    • Shares now +117% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • AUQ

    AuRico, Osisko upgraded at Credit Suisse

    • AuRico Gold (AUQ +3.2%) and Osisko Mining (OSKFF.PK +6.2%) are upgraded to Outperform from Neutral by Credit Suisse.
    • The firm notes that AUQ has changed management, transformed its asset base divesting higher cost mines to lower costs mines, revised expectations, and has delivered against targets; market hesitation remains, providing an attractive entry point.
    • Osisko's Malartic project is progressing to full production, costs are improving to levels in line with the sector average, liquidity is no longer an immediate concern, and its valuation remains attractive.
    • Despite the upgrade, the firm cuts its price target for AUQ to $5 from $5.50; it raises its target for Osisko to $7 from $6.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services dives on two-notch BofA/Merrill downgrade

    • Easy come, easy go: Less than a month after giving Liquidity Services (LQDT -9.6%) a two-notch upgrade to Buy from Underperform, BofA/Merrill's Nat Schindler has done the opposite.
    • Schindler observes Liquidity  reported Sep. gross merchandise volume (GMV) of $77M, -11% Y/Y. Though that figure means the salvage auction site had FQ4 (Sep. quarter) GMV of $250M (in-line with BofA/Merrill's estimate), Schindler was expecting a return to positive growth following increases of 7.1% and 14.5% in July and August.
    • Liquidity previously forecast FQ4 GMV of $200M-$225M. Shares -28% YTD and not far removed from a 52-week low of $27.26.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • PKT

    Procera higher after announcing Asia-Pac order

    • Procera (PKT +3.4%) has "received a first-time multi-million dollar order" from an unnamed major Asia-Pac mobile carrier for the company's deep packet inspection hardware. Procera says the orders is the first placed on a "multi-year framework contract," and the this from a major Asia-Pac carrier in the last five months. (PR)
    • Rival Allot saw its shares jump last week after announcing a deal with a U.S. cloud services provider. Following its Q2 report, Procera disclosed it had received a $20M order from a "mega-carrier" that will ramp in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • ANV

    Allied Nevada +16% on record gold production, sales results

    • Allied Nevada (ANV +16.1%) says it achieved record gold production and sales in Q3.
    • Its Hycroft mine produced a record 52,198 oz. of gold and 184,070 oz. of silver in Q3, and ANV sold a record 52,713 oz. of gold and 184,082 oz. of silver; ANV believes it is on track to achieve full-year production and sales guidance of 175K-200K oz. of gold and 0.9M-1.1M oz. of silver in 2013.
    • ANV's new 21.5K gal/minute Merrill-Crowe plant began commissioning at the end of Q3; the silver sales ratio is expected to increase with the exclusive use of the new Merrill-Crowe plant from ~3.5 oz. of silver for each oz. of gold produced to in excess of 6:1.
    • Shares are upgraded to Outperform from Sector Perform at Scotia Capital after ANV released the numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • ACFN

    Acorn Energy -21% on updated outlook, impairment charge, offering

    • Acorn Energy (OTC:ACFN -21.4%) plunges after disclosing its financial outlook, saying revenue and earnings performance for Q3 and full-year 2013 and 2014 will end materially below expectations.
    • ACFN will record an impairment charge as a result of write-downs of goodwill and other intangibles, and will record a restructuring charge with respect to its OmniMetrix subsidiary; the moves likely will have a material impact on Q3 operational results.
    • Also, ACFN files for a ~$15M common stock offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense higher following bullish Evercore, Craig-Hallum notes

    • After making Asian supply chain checks, Evercore's Patrick Wang says he believes InvenSense's (INVN +3.7%) motion sensors are now "ramping at Apple." Shares sold off last month after iPhone 5S teardowns failed to uncover InvenSense sensors.
    • Meanwhile, Craig-Hallum is talking up InvenSense's non-Apple design win activity. The firm thinks InvenSense has been designed into Amazon's latest Kindle Fires and Samsung's Galaxy Gear smartwatch (previous), among other products.
    • 26.7% of the float was shorted as of Sep. 13.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTRN

    Materion -8.7% after issuing Q3 warning but sees strong Q4

    • Materion (MTRN -8.7%) issues downside guidance for Q3, seeing EPS of ~$0.20 vs. $0.39 consensus estimate, and says shipments of certain high-margin beryllium-based defense and nuclear science as well as defense optics orders have been delayed.
    • MTRN also issues guidance for Q4, seeing EPS well ahead of Q3 and the strongest of the year, exceeding Q2's $0.43.
    • MTRN plans to take additional facility and product line rationalization actions during Q4, which will result in a charge of up to $0.15/share but should favorably impact 2014 performance by up to $0.30/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM

  • Junior gold miners ETF hit by LionGold plunge

    • The Junior Gold Miners ETF (GDXJ -0.4%) opened sharply lower (but has since recovered) after LionGold plunged 71% overnight in Singapore amid the deflating of a mini-small-cap bubble. At 4.78% of AUM, LionGold was GDXJ's largest holding at last report.
    • The decline had begun on Friday and the exchange suspended trading in LionGold and two other names citing concerns market participants might not be "fully informed." The dive accelerated after trading was re-opened.
    • The iShares MSCI Singapore Small-Cap ETF (EWSS -3.8%).
    • Thus far there doesn't appear to be much spillover into the blue-chip market (EWS -0.2%) - known mostly for its REITs and other dividend payers.
    • Other gold-mining ETFs: GDX, GDXJ, GLDX, PSAU, NUGT, DUST, GGGG, RING.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM

  • Bangkok slips, Manila rises in cautious trade

    • Thai (THD, TF, TTF) and Philippine (EPHE) shares are the only thing stirring in Southeast Asia, as cautious trading predominates amid worries over the U.S. government shutdown and debt ceiling.
    • SET -0.9%
    • PSEi +0.8%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • BB

    A roundup of tech ratings changes

    • BlackBerry (BBRY) has been upgraded to Neutral by Macquarie following a weekend report indicating the company is in talks to sell part or all of the company to Cisco, Google, SAP, and others. Shares +4% premarket.
    • IBM and Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) have been cut to Equal Weight by Barclays. IBM -1.4%.
    • Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) has been started with a Buy and $50 PT by SunTrust ahead of its IPO. The PT implies a $25B valuation.
    • Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) has been upgraded to Buy by BNP Paribas.
    • MaxLinear (NYSE:MXL) has been upgraded to Outperform by JMP following news the chipmaker has settled its patent dispute with Silicon Labs.
    • Citrix (NASDAQ:CTXS) has been upgraded to Overweight by Barclays.
    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) has received a two-notch downgrade to Underperform by Credit Agricole. Needham cut shares to Hold last week. Shares -2.3%.
    • PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia (NYSE:TLK) has been cut to Neutral by Credit Suisse.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GWPH +13%. OUTR +9%. CTIC +6%.
    • Losers: ATOS -52%. CTB -12%. DRYS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences jumps on German phase approval for Vitaros

    • Apricus Biosciences (APRI) gets national phase approval (the company's fifth) in Germany for Vitaros.
    • The company says the five remaining European phase approvals should be obtainable in Q4 and Q1 2014.
    • Vitaros' application for marketing approval is approved under the Decentralized Procedure. The Netherlands is the RMS.
    • APRI has multiple partners for the ED treatment including Takeda (OTCPK:TKPHF), Sandoz, and Abbott (NYSE:ABT). (PR)
    • APRI +10% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • RLGY

    Goldman makes a couple of housing calls

    • Goldman likes the brokerage business, upping Realogy (NYSE:RLGY) to Buy saying worries about royalty rates and commission splits, broad housing concerns, and large stock sales are already priced into the stock. "We expect these issues to diminish over the coming quarters."
    • How to buy Realogy? Take the cash from a sale of Toll Bros. (NYSE:TOL), says Goldman, removing its Buy rating on the homebuilder. Despite the downgrade, Goldman still likes Toll's position at the high end of the market and sees room for material margin expansion as the company works through its land-development progress.
    • TOL -2.4%, RLGY +0.4% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • OUTR

    Outerwall higher with Jana in the background

    • Shares of Outerwall (NASDAQ:OUTR) reach even greater heights as the news of the significant stake by Jana Partners in the company turns sentiment around.
    • Wedbush sees Jana gaining enough support from other shareholders to force a significant buyback initiative from Outerwall at the least and thinks it might even convince shareholders to back a breakup.
    • OUTR +7.8% premarket to $61.59 to mark its highest trading level in over a month.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • FB

    Facebook cut from Strong Buy at Raymond James

    • RayJay's Aaron Kessler - who banged the drum for Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) with an upgrade to Buy in January and an upgrade to Strong Buy in April (at prices well south of today's) - cuts his rating back to Buy following the big run in the stock price.
    • Kessler says his bullish thesis on the company is playing out as expected, but today's high valuation merits the downgrade.
    • Shares off 1.2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 14 Comments
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire & Rubber down sharply on buyout turmoil

    • Shares of Cooper Tire & Rubber (NYSE:CTB) dive after Apollo Tires makes a lot of noise about lowering the purchase price of the company below $35.
    • CTB -12.6% premarket to $25.81.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 1 Comment

  • Continued impasse in Washington hits equities

    • Global equities are lower after John Boehner said the GOP won't agree to support legislation to finance the government or raise the debt ceiling until the Democrats agree to talks about reducing the deficit.
    • "The U.S. shutdown saga is starting to really roil markets," says Capital Spreads trader Jonathan Sudaria. "What was once thought to be a case of chest thumping by politicians may have been underestimated by markets."
    • Japan -1.2%, Hong Kong -0.8%, China closed. India -0.6%.
    • EU Stoxx 50 -1.1%, London -0.7%, Paris -1.3%, Frankfurt -1.2%, Milan -0.4%, Madrid -0.8%.
    • U.S. stock futures: Dow -0.9%. S&P -1%. Nasdaq -1%.
    • Crude -1% to $102.82, Gold +0.05% to $1310.60.
    • U.S. Dollar index -0.2%.
    • Ten-year Treasury yield -3 bps to 2.62%.
    • ETFs: EZU, VGK, FEZ, EPV, IEV, ADRU, FEP, FDD, UPV, EPV, DFE, FEU, FEEU, ADRA, AIA, VPL, ASDR, AAXJ, AXJS, EPP, GMF, GMFS, AXJL, UXJ, JPX, PAF, ASEA, EEMA, DVYA, EFA, IEFA, VEA, ADRD, MFLA, EFO, EFU, PDN, PIZ, EFZ, PXF, EFG, EFV, DZK, DPK, IDLV, DTH, DWM, URTH, FDTS
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 AM
